Class Character

java.lang.Object
  Character
Direct Known Subclasses:
Fighter
public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object

Character - Common functions of all Character types.

Version:
0.8b
Author:
Yama H

Field Summary
protected  int action
          Represents the current method of movement of the Character as follows:
1 - walk
2 - strafe
3 - turn
protected  int anim
          Represents current state sprite of Character as follows:
1 - stand_right
2 - stand_left
3 - walk_right
4 - walk_left
protected  Field area
          Field in which this Character resides.
protected  int atk
          Current attack strength of this Character.
protected  Sprite charbmp
          Serves as a pointer to the Character's state sprites (spriteSheet[0] - spriteSheet[3] by default)
protected  boolean defending
          True if Character is defending.
protected  int direction
          Represents the current direction of the Character as follows:
0 - stop
1 - North
2 - East
3 - South
4 - West
protected  int exp
          Current exp of this Character.
protected  int hp
          Current HP of this Character.
protected  Coord initPos
          Spawn position of this Character.
static int JUMP_DIST
          Amount of pixels to move at a time.
protected  int longatk
          Current long range attack strength of this Character.
protected  int lv
          Current level of this Character.
static int MAX_PROJECTILES
          Maximum amount of simultaneous projectiles.
static int MAX_SIZE_X
          Max width of a Character sprite.
static int MAX_SIZE_Y
          Max height of a Character sprite.
protected  double melees
          Melee attack gauge.
protected  int numSprites
          Number of sprites that this Character needs.
protected  Coord pos
          Current position of this Character.
protected  double projectiles
          Projectile gauge.
protected  Projectile shield
          Projectile representing this Character's shield.
protected  java.lang.String[] spriteFiles
          To be specified in subclass.
protected  Sprite[] spriteSheet
          To be specified in subclass--default is:
spriteSheet[0] = stand_right
spriteSheet[1] = stand_left
spriteSheet[2] = walk_right
spriteSheet[3] = walk_left
spriteSheet[4] = shield_right
spriteSheet[5] = shield_left
spriteSheet[6] = sword_right
spriteSheet[7] = sword_left
spriteSheet[8] = projectile_right
spriteSheet[9] = projectile_left
protected  int totHP
          Current total HP of this Character.
protected  int ucid
          Unique Character ID of this Character.

Constant Field Values

charbmp

protected Sprite charbmp
Serves as a pointer to the Character's state sprites (spriteSheet[0] - spriteSheet[3] by default)

spriteSheet

protected Sprite[] spriteSheet
To be specified in subclass--default is:
spriteSheet[0] = stand_right
spriteSheet[1] = stand_left
spriteSheet[2] = walk_right
spriteSheet[3] = walk_left
spriteSheet[4] = shield_right
spriteSheet[5] = shield_left
spriteSheet[6] = sword_right
spriteSheet[7] = sword_left
spriteSheet[8] = projectile_right
spriteSheet[9] = projectile_left

spriteFiles

protected java.lang.String[] spriteFiles
To be specified in subclass. Contains filenames of sprites in spriteSheet, index values should correspond to those of spriteSheet.

numSprites

protected int numSprites
Number of sprites that this Character needs.

Constructor Detail

Character

protected Character(Field f,
                    Coord initPos,
                    java.lang.String[] spriteFiles)
Constructor for objects of type Character. Throws an IllegalStateException if the character cannot be drawn at the specified coordinates.

Parameters:
f - Field this Character is to be drawn upon
initPos - initial position of this Character
spriteFiles - array of all Filenames of all Sprites to be loaded into this Character

Determines whether the Character contains any of a set of coordinates.

Parameters:

Returns:
true if the Character contains any of the coordinates

modHP

protected boolean modHP(int dmg)
Modifies this character's HP.

Parameters:
dmg - amount by which to decrease the HP
Returns:
whether or not the modification killed the Character

modEXP

protected void modEXP(int exp)
Gives this Character experience points.

Parameters:
exp - amount of experience points to give

Restores pixels occupied by character's current state with original pixels of Field.

draw

protected boolean draw(Coord pos)
Draws the Character at a given position on the screen.

Parameters:
pos - coordinates to draw the Character at
Returns:
true if the character was successfully drawn, false if it could not be
